org.openstreetmap.josm.plugins.mapillary

Class MapillaryData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openstreetmap.josm.plugins.mapillary.MapillaryData

  • public class MapillaryData
extends java.lang.Object
    Database class for all the MapillaryAbstractImage objects.
    See Also:
    MapillaryAbstractImage, MapillarySequence

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<org.openstreetmap.josm.data.Bounds> bounds
      The bounds of the areas for which the pictures have been downloaded.

        Parameters:

      • add

        public void add(MapillaryAbstractImage image,
                boolean update)
        Adds a MapillaryImage to the object, but doesn't repaint mapView. This is needed for concurrency.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to be added.
        update - Whether the map must be updated or not.

      • dataUpdated

        public static void dataUpdated()
        Repaints mapView object.

      • getImages

        Returns a List containing all images.
        Returns:
        A List object containing all images.

      • getSelectedImage

        public MapillaryAbstractImage getSelectedImage()
        Returns the MapillaryImage object that is currently selected.
        Returns:
        The selected MapillaryImage object.

      • selectNext

        public void selectNext()
        If the selected MapillaryImage is part of a MapillarySequence then the following visible MapillaryImage is selected. In case there is none, does nothing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the selected image is null or the selected image doesn't belong to a sequence.

      • selectNext

        public void selectNext(boolean moveToPicture)
        If the selected MapillaryImage is part of a MapillarySequence then the following visible MapillaryImage is selected. In case there is none, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        moveToPicture - True if the view must me moved to the next picture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the selected image is null or the selected image doesn't belong to a sequence.

      • selectPrevious

        public void selectPrevious()
        If the selected MapillaryImage is part of a MapillarySequence then the previous visible MapillaryImage is selected. In case there is none, does nothing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the selected image is null or the selected image doesn't belong to a sequence.

      • selectPrevious

        public void selectPrevious(boolean moveToPicture)
        If the selected MapillaryImage is part of a MapillarySequence then the previous visible MapillaryImage is selected. In case there is none, does nothing. * @throws IllegalStateException if the selected image is null or the selected image doesn't belong to a sequence.
        Parameters:
        moveToPicture - True if the view must me moved to the previous picture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the selected image is null or the selected image doesn't belong to a sequence.

      • setSelectedImage

        public void setSelectedImage(MapillaryAbstractImage image)
        Selects a new image.If the user does ctrl + click, this isn't triggered.
        Parameters:
        image - The MapillaryImage which is going to be selected

      • setSelectedImage

        public void setSelectedImage(MapillaryAbstractImage image,
                             boolean zoom)
        Selects a new image.If the user does ctrl+click, this isn't triggered. You can choose whether to center the view on the new image or not.
        Parameters:
        image - The MapillaryImage which is going to be selected.
        zoom - True if the view must be centered on the image; false otherwise.

      • addMultiSelectedImage

        public void addMultiSelectedImage(MapillaryAbstractImage image)
        Adds a MapillaryImage object to the list of selected images, (when ctrl + click)
        Parameters:
        image - The MapillaryImage object to be added.

      • addMultiSelectedImage

        public void addMultiSelectedImage(java.util.List<MapillaryAbstractImage> images)
        Adds a set of MapillaryAbstractImage objects to the list of selected images.
        Parameters:
        images - A List object containing the set of images to be added.

      • getMultiSelectedImages

        public java.util.List<MapillaryAbstractImage> getMultiSelectedImages()
        Returns a List containing all MapillaryAbstractImage objects selected with ctrl + click.
        Returns:
        A List object containing all the images selected.

      • setImages

        public void setImages(java.util.List<MapillaryAbstractImage> images)
        Sets a new ArrayList object as the used set of images.
        Parameters:
        images - the new image list (previously set images are completely replaced)

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the amount of images contained by this object.
        Returns:
        The amount of images in stored.
